conclusion: Velocity increases while acceleration is positive, stops increasing when acceleration is zero, and decreases when acceleration is negative.
Velocity is greatest when acceleration changes sign (passes through zero).
From t = 0 s to t = 1 s, acceleration is +2 m/s² (positive).
From t = 1 s to t = 2 s, acceleration falls linearly from +2 m/s² to 0, remaining positive.
At t = 2 s, acceleration is exactly zero.
Beyond t = 2 s, acceleration becomes negative, sloping down to -2 m/s².
Velocity attains maximum value when acceleration first becomes zero.
Final answer: the velocity is maximum at t = 2 s.
